ftc.team6460.javadeck.api.motion

Interface UnencoderedMotor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EffectorPeripheral<java.lang.Double>, Maintainable, RobotPeripheral
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    EncoderedMotor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AntiStallFilter, MotorGearingFilter

    public interface UnencoderedMotor
extends EffectorPeripheral<java.lang.Double>
    Represents a motor without an encoder, or with an encoder whose values are to be disregarded. Subclasses must be thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Called each event loop.
      void write(java.lang.Double input)
      Sets the motor speed to the new value.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(java.lang.Double input)
    throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
           PeripheralCommunicationException,
           PeripheralInoperableException
        Sets the motor speed to the new value. This method should be overridden if it is possible to determine when the motor has spun up to its target speed. The input may specify the speed in an implementation-dependent unit, but a given robot platform should implement this so that all motors of the same type will cause the same linear motion after their gearing is considered. Inconsistent speeds across gearing configurations may break the motion planner. This may require instances of this to have fields describing any gearing or other considerations.
        Specified by:
        write in interface EffectorPeripheral<java.lang.Double>
        Parameters:
        input - The speed for the motor to reach.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If interrupted waiting for the effector to reach its target value.
        PeripheralCommunicationException - If the motor cannot be communicated with.
        PeripheralInoperableException - If the motor is inoperable.

      • writeFast

        void writeFast(java.lang.Double input)
        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
               PeripheralCommunicationException,
               PeripheralInoperableException
        Sets the speed of the motor to the new value. The input may specify the speed in an implementation-dependent unit, but a given robot platform should implement this so that all motors of the same type will cause the same linear motion after their gearing is considered. This may require instances of this to have fields describing any gearing or other considerations.
        Specified by:
        writeFast in interface EffectorPeripheral<java.lang.Double>
        Parameters:
        input - The value to write.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If interrupted waiting for the write to finish.
        PeripheralCommunicationException - If the effector cannot be communicated with.
        PeripheralInoperableException - If the effector is inoperable.

      • loop

        Called each event loop.
